greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,h) = number of functions f:{1,2,...,n}->{1,2,...,n} such that |Image(f)|=h; h=1,2,...,n, n=1,2,3,... . Essentially A090657, but without zeros.
comment: Row sums = n^n. T(n,1) = n, T(n,n) = n!.
formula: T(n, h) = C(n, h)*U(n, h), where U(n, h) is the array in A019538. Thus T(n, h) = C(n, h)*h!*S(n, h), where S(n, h) is a Stirling number of the second kind (given by A048993 with zeros removed).
mathematica: Table[Table[StirlingS2[n, k] Binomial[n, k] k!, {k, 1, n}], {n, 1, 8}] // Grid
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 17 2004
